reading_struggles.title: üìñ I read the whole page but don't remember anything
reading_struggles.when_to_use: You're reading but comprehension isn't sticking
reading_struggles.full_prompt: I just read [number] pages of [material type] but I can't remember what I read. My brain is tired from just decoding the words. Help me: 1) summarize what this is about, 2) explain the main ideas in simple language, 3) give me a way to remember it. Here's the text: [paste]

reading_struggles.title: ‚è±Ô∏è How can I read faster without losing everything?
reading_struggles.when_to_use: You're spending hours on reading and falling behind classmates
reading_struggles.full_prompt: I read slowly and spend all my time decoding words, so I miss the meaning. I have [timeframe] to read [material]. Help me: 1) pre-read strategy, 2) what to focus on, 3) how to chunk this into manageable pieces

reading_struggles.title: üîÑ Why do I skip words or read sentences out of order?
reading_struggles.when_to_use: You're seeing words jump around or reading lines wrong
reading_struggles.full_prompt: When I read, I skip words or read lines out of order. Sometimes letters seem to move. Is this normal? Explain what's happening in my brain and what I can do about it.

reading_struggles.title: üéØ Help me break down this confusing text
reading_struggles.when_to_use: Academic paper, dense instructions, or complex material
reading_struggles.full_prompt: This [text type] is confusing and hard to follow. Can you: 1) break it into shorter chunks, 2) explain what each part means, 3) highlight the most important parts, 4) create questions I should be able to answer after reading. Here's the text: [paste]

reading_struggles.title: üò∞ I'm anxious about reading out loud
reading_struggles.when_to_use: You're dreading being called on in class or at work
reading_struggles.full_prompt: I get really anxious when I have to read out loud because I trip over words and people judge me. Help me understand why this happens and give me strategies to feel more confident (or things I can say if I mess up).

writing_challenges.title: ‚úçÔ∏è I spell the same word three different ways. How do I fix this?
writing_challenges.when_to_use: Your spelling is inconsistent and spell-check doesn't catch it all
writing_challenges.full_prompt: My spelling is all over the place‚Äîsame word spelled 3 different ways in one document. I need to write [type of document]. Can you: 1) explain why this happens, 2) give me techniques to catch it, 3) help me write this error-free. Here's what I need to write: [topic/draft]

writing_challenges.title: üí≠ I know what I want to say but can't get it out on paper
writing_challenges.when_to_use: Your ideas are clear in your head but jumbled when written
writing_challenges.full_prompt: I have great ideas in my head but when I write it comes out as a confusing mess. Help me organize my thoughts for [type: essay/email/proposal]. Here's what I'm thinking: [explain verbally/bullet point]. Turn this into something clear and organized.

writing_challenges.title: üó£Ô∏è Can you help me write this professionally?
writing_challenges.full_prompt: I need to write a [email/letter/proposal] to [person/type]. I'm worried about: [spelling/tone/making sense]. Here's what I want to say: [your draft or idea]. Can you help me write it professionally without losing my voice?

writing_challenges.title: üìù Help me organize my essay/story/report
writing_challenges.when_to_use: You have ideas but can't structure them into a coherent piece
writing_challenges.full_prompt: I need to write [type] about [topic] but I don't know how to organize it. I have these ideas: [list them]. Help me: 1) organize these in order, 2) create an outline, 3) write a paragraph for each section that I can expand on.

writing_challenges.title: üîß Can you fix my spelling/grammar without changing my voice?
writing_challenges.when_to_use: You've written something but need help with errors
writing_challenges.full_prompt: I wrote this [document type] but I know it has spelling and grammar mistakes. Can you: 1) fix the errors, 2) highlight what I got wrong so I learn, 3) keep it sounding like me. Here's what I wrote: [paste]

organization_executive_function.title: ‚è∞ I lost track of time again‚Äîhow do I stop this?
organization_executive_function.when_to_use: You consistently lose hours or can't sense time passing
organization_executive_function.full_prompt: I started a [task] at [time] and suddenly it's [time]‚ÄîI lose track of time constantly and people think I'm late on purpose. Help me: 1) understand why this happens, 2) create a system to track time, 3) set up [specific task] with time checkpoints.

organization_executive_function.title: üóùÔ∏è Where do I put my keys? I can never find anything
organization_executive_function.when_to_use: You constantly lose items, forget where you put things
organization_executive_function.full_prompt: I lose things constantly‚Äîkeys, phone, important documents. Help me create a system where I: 1) always know where things are, 2) can find them when I need them, 3) don't forget I put it somewhere. What works for dyslexic brains?

organization_executive_function.title: üìã My to-do list is out of control (7 pages and growing)
organization_executive_function.when_to_use: You have too many tasks and don't know where to start
organization_executive_function.full_prompt: My to-do list is out of control‚ÄîI have [number] things to do and I'm overwhelmed. Help me: 1) decide what ACTUALLY matters, 2) prioritize these 5 things for today, 3) create a system so I don't feel like I'm drowning. Here are my tasks: [list]

organization_executive_function.title: ‚ùå I started this task but never finished it. How do I actually complete things?
organization_executive_function.when_to_use: You have trouble starting or completing tasks
organization_executive_function.full_prompt: I'm really good at starting projects but struggle to finish them. [Task] needs to be done by [date]. Help me: 1) break it into tiny steps, 2) set up checkpoints so I don't abandon it, 3) create accountability. What's my first step?

organization_executive_function.title: üìÖ Help me plan my week/month/project
organization_executive_function.when_to_use: You need to organize time/tasks for something upcoming
organization_executive_function.full_prompt: I have [project/event/timeline] coming up and I need a plan. Help me: 1) break it into steps, 2) assign realistic time for each, 3) figure out what order to do things, 4) tell me what to do first. Here's what I'm planning: [describe]

organization_executive_function.title: üß† How do I remember what I'm supposed to do?
organization_executive_function.when_to_use: You can't retain verbal instructions or forget tasks
organization_executive_function.full_prompt: I forget things immediately after I'm told them. [Person] told me to [task] but I already forgot. Help me: 1) create a memory system for this, 2) give me a template to write things down, 3) explain how to use my phone to remember, 4) what to do RIGHT NOW for [this task].

confidence_self_esteem.title: üòû I feel stupid but I know I'm not. How do I fix this feeling?
confidence_self_esteem.when_to_use: You're struggling with imposter syndrome or shame about dyslexia
confidence_self_esteem.full_prompt: I'm intelligent but because of dyslexia, people think I'm stupid. Inside I believe it sometimes. Help me: 1) understand why this happens to dyslexic people, 2) reframe my struggles as strengths, 3) build confidence in my actual intelligence. What's really true about me?

confidence_self_esteem.title: üò∞ I'm terrified of being found out as a fraud
confidence_self_esteem.when_to_use: You have imposter syndrome even though you're successful
confidence_self_esteem.full_prompt: I [accomplishment] but I feel like a fraud. I'm convinced people will find out I'm not as smart/capable as they think. Why do dyslexic people feel this way even when we're successful? How do I stop this feeling?

confidence_self_esteem.title: üí™ Help me recognize and own my strengths
confidence_self_esteem.when_to_use: You're only focused on what you're bad at
confidence_self_esteem.full_prompt: I'm so focused on what's hard for me that I can't see my strengths. I'm good at [areas]. Help me: 1) identify my actual strengths, 2) see how dyslexia might have MADE me better at certain things, 3) build confidence in what I CAN do.

confidence_self_esteem.title: üò≠ I made a mistake and now I'm spiraling. Help me
confidence_self_esteem.when_to_use: A mistake feels like proof you're incompetent
confidence_self_esteem.full_prompt: I made a mistake at [work/school] and I'm convinced it means I'm stupid/incompetent/don't belong. Help me: 1) reality-check my thoughts, 2) see this as a normal mistake not a character flaw, 3) move forward without spiraling.

confidence_self_esteem.title: üéØ Give me a pep talk before [presentation/meeting/situation]
confidence_self_esteem.when_to_use: You're nervous about something and need confidence boosting
confidence_self_esteem.full_prompt: I have [situation: presentation/interview/difficult conversation] coming up and I'm anxious. Remind me: 1) what I'm actually good at, 2) that dyslexia doesn't define me, 3) I can do this. Give me words I can repeat to myself.

social_disclosure.title: üíº Should I tell my boss about my dyslexia?
social_disclosure.when_to_use: Weighing whether to disclose at work
social_disclosure.full_prompt: I'm considering telling my boss I have dyslexia. I'm worried they'll think I'm not capable or use it against me. Help me think through: 1) pros and cons of telling, 2) when to tell, 3) what to say, 4) what to do if they react badly. Context: [your situation]

social_disclosure.title: üìß Help me write a disclosure email
social_disclosure.when_to_use: You need to tell someone (boss, professor, HR) about your dyslexia
social_disclosure.full_prompt: I need to tell [person/role] about my dyslexia. I want to: 1) explain it clearly, 2) ask for what I need, 3) not sound defensive, 4) keep my credibility. Help me write an email that does this.

social_disclosure.title: üó£Ô∏è How do I explain dyslexia to [friend/family/coworker]?
social_disclosure.when_to_use: People don't understand your dyslexia and make assumptions
social_disclosure.full_prompt: [Person/group] doesn't understand dyslexia. They think [misconception]. Help me explain dyslexia in a way that: 1) is accurate, 2) helps them understand ME, 3) is simple and not defensive, 4) doesn't make them feel bad.

social_disclosure.title: üë• Help me handle [awkward situation] without shame
social_disclosure.when_to_use: Dyslexia created an embarrassing moment and you need to move forward
social_disclosure.full_prompt: I [situation: missed a reservation, misspelled someone's name, forgot something important] because of dyslexia/time blindness. Now [consequence]. How do I: 1) handle this, 2) explain without making excuses, 3) keep my dignity, 4) prevent it next time?

social_disclosure.title: üòï I want to tell people but I don't want to be defined by dyslexia
social_disclosure.when_to_use: You're conflicted about disclosure and identity
social_disclosure.full_prompt: I want people to understand my dyslexia but I don't want to be 'the dyslexic person.' Help me find the balance: 1) when and how to mention it, 2) how to own it without being defined by it, 3) what to say to redirect if people get too focused on it.

social_disclosure.title: ‚ù§Ô∏è How do I explain my needs to my partner/date?
social_disclosure.when_to_use: You need to explain dyslexia-related needs (time blindness, reading texts, etc.) to someone you're close to
social_disclosure.full_prompt: My [partner/date] doesn't understand why I [time blindness/can't read quickly/forget things]. Instead of them thinking I don't care, help me explain: 1) what's actually happening, 2) why I need [accommodation], 3) what they can do to support me, 4) how to say this with humor.

accommodations_advocacy.title: üìã Help me request accommodations (IEP/504/work)
accommodations_advocacy.when_to_use: You need to ask for official accommodations
accommodations_advocacy.full_prompt: I need to request accommodations for [school/work]. I have dyslexia and specifically struggle with [areas]. Help me: 1) write a formal request, 2) list what accommodations I actually need, 3) explain WHY each one helps, 4) prepare for pushback.

accommodations_advocacy.title: üéØ What accommodations should I actually ask for?
accommodations_advocacy.when_to_use: You're not sure what accommodations exist or what would help
accommodations_advocacy.full_prompt: I have dyslexia and need [area: support in school/work, exam accommodations, etc.] but I don't know what to ask for. Help me figure out: 1) what accommodations exist, 2) which ones would actually help MY brain, 3) how to describe what I need.

accommodations_advocacy.title: üó£Ô∏è How do I advocate for myself without sounding difficult?
accommodations_advocacy.when_to_use: You need accommodations but worry you'll seem like you're making excuses
accommodations_advocacy.full_prompt: I need [accommodation] but I'm worried I'll sound like I'm making excuses or being difficult. Help me: 1) frame my needs confidently, 2) explain without over-apologizing, 3) stand firm if they push back, 4) what to do if they deny my request.

accommodations_advocacy.title: üìù The school/employer won't give me what I need. What do I do?
accommodations_advocacy.when_to_use: Your requests for accommodations are being denied
accommodations_advocacy.full_prompt: I requested [accommodation] but [school/employer] said no/ignored me. I've tried [what you've done]. Help me: 1) understand my rights, 2) know if their answer is actually legal, 3) what my next steps are, 4) who I can contact for help.

accommodations_advocacy.title: ‚è∞ Help me prepare for an IEP/504/accommodation meeting
accommodations_advocacy.when_to_use: You have a formal meeting coming up to discuss accommodations
accommodations_advocacy.full_prompt: I have an IEP/504/accommodation meeting on [date]. I want to make sure my child/I get [specific support]. Help me: 1) write down what I want to say, 2) list the accommodations to request, 3) prepare answers to common questions, 4) what to do if they refuse.

tools_strategies.title: üõ†Ô∏è Which tool is best for [specific need]?
tools_strategies.when_to_use: You know tools exist but not sure which one to use
tools_strategies.full_prompt: I need help with [reading/writing/organizing/remembering]. I've heard of [tools/apps mentioned]. Which one would work best for me? Help me compare and pick the right one. Here's what I specifically need: [describe]

tools_strategies.title: üíª Show me how to use [specific tool/app]
tools_strategies.when_to_use: You have a tool but don't know how to set it up or use it
tools_strategies.full_prompt: I have [tool: text-to-speech/speech-to-text/organization app] but I'm not sure how to use it. Help me: 1) set it up, 2) use it for [specific task], 3) troubleshoot if it's not working right, 4) make it part of my routine.

tools_strategies.title: üìö What's the best font/colored overlay/format for reading?
tools_strategies.when_to_use: You want to optimize reading setup
tools_strategies.full_prompt: I struggle with reading [specific issue: visual stress/tracking/comprehension]. What format works best? Should I use: 1) specific fonts, 2) colored overlays, 3) ebook vs paper, 4) text size? Help me set up the best reading environment.

tools_strategies.title: ‚úçÔ∏è Help me study/take notes better
tools_strategies.full_prompt: Studying the traditional way isn't working for my brain. I have [upcoming: test/project] on [topic]. Help me: 1) create study methods that work for dyslexic brains, 2) set up note-taking, 3) practice for the test, 4) remember the material.

tools_strategies.title: üé® Help me create a visual system for [task/project/life area]
tools_strategies.full_prompt: Lists and traditional organizing don't stick in my brain. I need to organize/remember/plan [what]. Help me create: 1) a visual system, 2) mind maps, 3) color-coding, 4) pictures/symbols instead of words.

understanding_dyslexia.title: üß† Do I have dyslexia? What are the real signs?
understanding_dyslexia.when_to_use: You're wondering if you're dyslexic or just slow at reading
understanding_dyslexia.full_prompt: I've always struggled with [specific difficulties]. Do I have dyslexia or am I just a slow reader? Help me understand: 1) what dyslexia actually is, 2) the real signs (not myths), 3) whether these sound like dyslexia, 4) what to do next if I think I have it.

understanding_dyslexia.title: üìã Explain [dyslexia concept] in simple terms
understanding_dyslexia.when_to_use: You want to understand dyslexia better
understanding_dyslexia.full_prompt: Explain [concept: how dyslexia affects memory, why spelling is hard, what dyslexia actually is, how it affects my brain] in simple language. Help me understand WHY this happens, not just that it does.

understanding_dyslexia.title: ü§î What's the difference between [dyslexia/ADHD/other condition]?
understanding_dyslexia.full_prompt: I've heard I might have [conditions mentioned]. What's the difference between [condition 1] and [condition 2]? Can you have both? Help me understand which one I might have or if it's both.

understanding_dyslexia.title: üí° Is dyslexia actually a superpower?
understanding_dyslexia.when_to_use: You want to reframe dyslexia positively
understanding_dyslexia.full_prompt: People say dyslexia gives you superpowers. Is that real or just toxic positivity? Help me: 1) understand what dyslexic brains ARE good at, 2) see the real strengths, 3) balance the struggles with the strengths, 4) own my dyslexia as part of who I am.

understanding_dyslexia.title: üòï Will I always have dyslexia? Will my kids have it?
understanding_dyslexia.when_to_use: You have questions about dyslexia as a permanent condition and genetics
understanding_dyslexia.full_prompt: Can dyslexia go away? Will my kids have it? If I have kids will they be dyslexic? Help me understand: 1) what dyslexia is for life, 2) how genetics work, 3) what I should know about family planning or parenting.

parent_prompts.title: üéì My child is struggling at school. What do I do?
parent_prompts.when_to_use: Your child is falling behind and school isn't helping
parent_prompts.full_prompt: My child is struggling with [reading/writing/school]. The school says [their response]. I think dyslexia is involved. Help me: 1) get my child evaluated, 2) understand IEP vs 504, 3) advocate at school, 4) support at home. What's my first step?

parent_prompts.title: üíî My child says they're stupid. How do I help their confidence?
parent_prompts.when_to_use: Your dyslexic child is struggling with self-esteem
parent_prompts.full_prompt: My child is saying 'I'm stupid' and giving up because they struggle with reading. They're bright but dyslexia is crushing their confidence. Help me: 1) respond in the moment, 2) build their confidence, 3) help them see their strengths, 4) what to say about dyslexia.

parent_prompts.title: üìö What reading program should I use? OG vs Wilson vs Barton?
parent_prompts.when_to_use: Trying to choose a tutoring method
parent_prompts.full_prompt: I'm looking for a tutor or program for my child's dyslexia. I've heard about [programs]. Help me: 1) understand what each does, 2) which is best for what kind of dyslexia, 3) what to look for in a tutor, 4) what's realistic for results.

parent_prompts.title: üò≠ Homework time is a battle every night
parent_prompts.when_to_use: Homework is causing daily stress and tears
parent_prompts.full_prompt: Homework is destroying us. My child comes home and immediately falls apart over [subject]. It takes [hours], we both cry, and no one learns anything. Help me: 1) make homework manageable, 2) strategies for difficult subjects, 3) how to support without doing it for them, 4) when to push back on school.

parent_prompts.title: üéí How do I advocate for my child at school?
parent_prompts.when_to_use: You need to push for accommodations from school
parent_prompts.full_prompt: The school won't [accommodate/test/take my concerns seriously] for my child's dyslexia. I've tried [what you've tried]. Help me: 1) write a formal request, 2) know my legal rights, 3) prepare for the meeting, 4) what to do if they still refuse.

parent_prompts.title: üë©‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è Do I get the IEP or 504? The school is confusing me
parent_prompts.when_to_use: Trying to understand what accommodations your child needs
parent_prompts.full_prompt: The school mentioned IEP and 504 but I don't understand the difference. My child [situation]. Which one do I need? Help me understand: 1) what each is, 2) which my child qualifies for, 3) what happens with each, 4) what to ask for.

parent_prompts.title: üí∞ Tutoring is $10,000+. What are other options?
parent_prompts.full_prompt: Tutoring is too expensive [$cost]. What are my other options? Help me: 1) free or affordable alternatives, 2) do-it-yourself strategies that work, 3) school support I can ask for, 4) DIY programs I can use, 5) what's realistic if I do it myself.

student_prompts.title: üéì I'm falling behind in college because of reading
student_prompts.full_prompt: I have [amount] of reading due [timeframe] and I can't do it. Other students seem to handle it fine but my brain takes longer. Help me: 1) manage the reading load, 2) use text-to-speech effectively, 3) study smarter, 4) catch up without losing my mind.

student_prompts.title: üìù Should I tell my professor about my dyslexia?
student_prompts.when_to_use: Weighing whether to disclose at college
student_prompts.full_prompt: I'm thinking about telling my professor I have dyslexia. I'm worried they'll judge me or think I'm looking for an 'easy pass.' Help me: 1) decide if I should tell, 2) what to say, 3) when to say it, 4) what happens next.

student_prompts.title: üè¢ How do I register with disability services?
student_prompts.when_to_use: You need official accommodations in college
student_prompts.full_prompt: I need to set up accommodations for college but I don't know how. Help me: 1) find disability services, 2) what documentation I need, 3) what accommodations to request, 4) how to use them in classes.

student_prompts.title: üìö Help me write this essay/paper
student_prompts.when_to_use: Assignment is due and writing is hard
student_prompts.full_prompt: I have a [essay/research paper/assignment] due [date] on [topic]. I'm struggling with: [reading the material/organizing thoughts/writing it down]. Help me: 1) understand the topic, 2) organize my ideas, 3) start writing, 4) check my work.

student_prompts.title: ‚è∞ I can't finish assignments on time
student_prompts.when_to_use: Time management in school is impossible
student_prompts.full_prompt: I can never finish assignments by the deadline. It takes me longer to read, write, and understand. I have [assignment] due [date]. Help me: 1) realistic timeline for this, 2) break it into steps, 3) time management system, 4) what to do if I still can't finish.

student_prompts.title: üé§ I'm terrified to read out loud in class
student_prompts.full_prompt: I panic when the teacher asks me to read aloud. I mess up, kids laugh, and I'm mortified. Help me: 1) understand why this happens, 2) strategies to manage it, 3) what to say to the teacher, 4) ways to participate that don't involve reading aloud.

student_prompts.title: üß† I can understand this verbally but can't show it on a written test
student_prompts.when_to_use: There's a gap between what you know and what you can demonstrate
student_prompts.full_prompt: I understand [topic/material] when we talk about it, but on written tests I do poorly. I have a test [subject/date]. Help me: 1) understand why this happens, 2) study differently for written tests, 3) request accommodations, 4) prepare for this specific test.

professional_adult_prompts.title: üíº How do I handle mistakes at work without spiraling?
professional_adult_prompts.when_to_use: Work errors triggered shame and self-doubt
professional_adult_prompts.full_prompt: I made a mistake at work ([error type]) and now I'm convinced I'm going to be fired/demoted/exposed as incompetent. Help me: 1) reality-check my thoughts, 2) handle the situation professionally, 3) learn from it, 4) move forward without shame.

professional_adult_prompts.title: üìß I need to send a crucial email without mistakes
professional_adult_prompts.when_to_use: Important communication and you're worried about errors
professional_adult_prompts.full_prompt: I need to write an important email to [recipient] about [topic]. I'm worried about spelling/grammar mistakes that make me look bad. Help me: 1) write it, 2) proofread it, 3) make it professional, 4) keep my voice.

professional_adult_prompts.title: üéØ What accommodations can I ask for at work?
professional_adult_prompts.full_prompt: I need [type of support] at work because of dyslexia. What can I actually ask for without seeming difficult? Help me: 1) list realistic accommodations, 2) which ones would help most, 3) how to frame them, 4) what's illegal for them to refuse.

professional_adult_prompts.title: üò∞ I'm worried about job interviews because of written tests
professional_adult_prompts.full_prompt: The job I want has a written test/writing sample in the interview. I'm dyslexic and this isn't a fair measure of my actual ability. Help me: 1) prepare the best I can, 2) request accommodations, 3) what to say if I struggle, 4) how to advocate for myself.

professional_adult_prompts.title: üöÄ Should I disclose my dyslexia when applying for jobs?
professional_adult_prompts.full_prompt: Should I mention my dyslexia on my job application/resume? I'm worried it will hurt my chances. Help me: 1) pros and cons, 2) when to mention it, 3) how to frame it positively, 4) what to do if asked.

professional_adult_prompts.title: üí¨ My boss says I'm making careless mistakes. How do I explain?
professional_adult_prompts.when_to_use: Being criticized for errors that aren't carelessness
professional_adult_prompts.full_prompt: My boss says I make 'careless mistakes' but they're dyslexia-related (spelling, transposing numbers, etc.). I work hard but my brain processes differently. Help me: 1) explain without making excuses, 2) show I care, 3) ask for support, 4) create systems to catch errors.

teacher_educator_prompts.title: üë®‚Äçüè´ How do I teach [subject] to dyslexic students?
teacher_educator_prompts.full_prompt: I have dyslexic students in my [subject] class. I want to make my teaching work for their brains. Help me: 1) modify my lessons, 2) multimodal strategies, 3) assessments that show what they know, 4) specific ideas for [subject].

teacher_educator_prompts.title: üéØ What accommodations should I offer proactively?
teacher_educator_prompts.when_to_use: You want to help without students having to ask
teacher_educator_prompts.full_prompt: I want to offer accommodations to my dyslexic students without waiting for requests. What actually helps? Should I offer: [options]? Help me: 1) list useful accommodations, 2) how to present them, 3) which students benefit, 4) how to implement.

teacher_educator_prompts.title: ‚úçÔ∏è How do I create accessible materials for my class?
teacher_educator_prompts.when_to_use: Modifying existing materials to be dyslexia-friendly
teacher_educator_prompts.full_prompt: I want to make my [materials: worksheets/readings/assignments] accessible to dyslexic students. Help me: 1) convert these materials, 2) font/formatting changes, 3) add visuals/structure, 4) make them available multiple ways. Here's what I have: [describe]

teacher_educator_prompts.title: üòí A student won't read aloud‚Äîis it laziness or anxiety?
teacher_educator_prompts.full_prompt: My student [description of resistance to reading aloud/participating]. I'm wondering if it's attitude or if they're struggling. Help me understand: 1) why dyslexic students avoid reading aloud, 2) what's really happening, 3) how to support them, 4) ways to let them participate differently.

teacher_educator_prompts.title: ‚≠ê How do I build strengths instead of just fixing weaknesses?
teacher_educator_prompts.when_to_use: Wanting to celebrate what dyslexic students ARE good at
teacher_educator_prompts.full_prompt: My dyslexic students are constantly hearing what's wrong with them. I want to help them see their strengths. Help me: 1) spot dyslexic superpowers, 2) name their strengths specifically, 3) build confidence, 4) make school about more than 'fixing' reading.
